extendedIngredients.name: cauliflower
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 small head cauliflower, cut into florets

extendedIngredients.name: greek yogurt
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup light sour cream or Greek yogurt

extendedIngredients.name: light cream cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 ounces light cream cheese, room temperature

recipes.title: Roasted Cauliflower and Aged White Cheddar Dip

winePairing.pairingText: Dip can be paired with Sparkling rosé and Sparkling Wine. If you're serving a selection of appetizers, you can't go wrong with these. Both are very food friendly and complement a variety of flavors. The Bellissima Sparkling rosé with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 24 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Bellissima Sparkling Rose
productMatches.description: This is an elegant, bright rosé, with hints of strawberry and grapefruit, and a soft, persistent foam. Uncorked at the very last minute, Bellissima Sparkling Rosé pairs perfectly with smoked salmon, shellfish, and seafood hor d’oeuvres such as tuna tartare, sushi, and sashimi.

recipes.instructions: Toss the cauliflower in the oil with salt and pepper, arrange in a single layer on a baking sheet and roast in a preheated 400F oven until lightly golden brown, about 20-30 minutes, mixing half way through.Puree everything in a food processor and pour into a baking dish.Bake in a preheated 350F oven until the sides are bubbling and the top is lightly golden brown, about 20-30 minutes.

steps.step: Toss the cauliflower in the oil with salt and pepper, arrange in a single layer on a baking sheet and roast in a preheated 400F oven until lightly golden brown, about 20-30 minutes, mixing half way through.Puree everything in a food processor and pour into a baking dish.
Bake in a preheated 350F oven until the sides are bubbling and the top is lightly golden brown, about 20-30 minutes.
